required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a German Version of the Patient Rated Tennis Elbow Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a German Version of the Patient Rated Tennis Elbow Evaluation (PRTEE)

brief_summary.textblock: The German version of the Patient Rated Tennis Elbow Evaluation (PRTEE) questionnaire is tested for reliability, validity and responsiveness.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this prospective study, patients with lateral epicondylitis will complete the PRTEE before ACP injection, 6 weeks after treatment and 2-11 days later.
The statistics will include analyses about reliability, validity and responsiveness.

primary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire Patient Rated Tennis Elbow Evaluation
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to complete questionnaires at each of three measurement time points.

secondary_outcome.description: The socio-demographic data includes the patient's age, sex, duration of symptoms, handedness and disease-related data

secondary_outcome.measure: The Disabilities of Arm Shoulder and Hand (DASH) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: The patient questionnaire measures impairment of the upper extremity
It measures the elbow specific pain and limitations
general measure of health for clinical and economic questions
perceived change regarding their elbow condition

arm_group.description: Patients with lateral epicondylitis who are treated with at least one ACP injection.

intervention.intervention_name: Questionnaire Patient Rated Tennis Elbow Evaluation
intervention.description: Participants are asked to complete questionnaires at three measurement time points.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 18 years of age
- Diagnosed lateral epicondylitis
- Receive a first ACP treatment at the Schulthess Klinik
- Signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of German language skills, which make it impossible to complete the questionnaire
- Diseases or conditions that would prevent accurate evaluation (e.g. central neurological, psychiatric or metabolic diseases)
- Legal incompetence
- Recent operations on the elbow or hand (less than three months ago)
